alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 4:31AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Bryan and Atoka Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 431 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Wardville to 8 miles north of Bennington to 3 miles northeast of Ravenna. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Atoka, Bokchito, Stringtown, Bennington, Blue, Lane, Utica, Wardville, Daisy, Albany, Atoka Reservoir, Wade, Chockie, Bentley, McGee Creek Lake, Redden and Darwin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
